snippet: New charges are filed against a one-legged man who won a police brutality suit, a professor calls New York's election season the "twilight zone," and more news from around the city.
abstract: New charges are filed against a one-legged man who won a police brutality suit, a professor calls New York's election season the "twilight zone," and more news from around the city.
lead_paragraph: For more local news from The Times, including a child pornography case against a teacher's aide that led to more incriminating evidence; panic buttons and pay raises for New York City's hotel staff; voters' disapproval of Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg's handling of public schools;
